meanings.definition: The quality or state of being substantial.
meanings.sent1: The substantivenesses of the building made it sturdy.
meanings.sent2: Her argument lacked substantivenesses without evidence.
meanings.sent3: The cake's substantivenesses was so strong, it didn't collapse under the weight of the frosting.
meanings.sent4: His words carried the substantivenesses of a mountain, unyielding and firm.
meanings.sent5: The substantivenesses of the tree trunk was evident in its solid structure.

meanings.definition: The ability to provide substance or support.
meanings.sent1: The substantivenesses of the wall held up the roof.
meanings.sent2: The team's unity gave substantivenesses to their cause.
meanings.sent3: The pillow's substantivenesses was so great, it never lost its shape.
meanings.sent4: Her advice acted as a substantivenesses, grounding him in reality.
meanings.sent5: The substantivenesses of the foundation was crucial for the stability of the house.

meanings.definition: The essence or importance of something.
meanings.sent1: The substantivenesses of the meeting lay in the decisions made.
meanings.sent2: In literature, the substantivenesses of a character drives the plot.
meanings.sent3: The substantivenesses of the joke was lost in translation.
meanings.sent4: Her smile held the substantivenesses of joy and contentment.
meanings.sent5: The substantivenesses of the painting captured the artist's emotions perfectly.
